bug.author: houzeyu2683
bug.summary: After training, the error in the test.py.
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
I use my custom data with 100 class, and the training process is not problem. After finish all epochs, the error like blow. <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/42731603/70769047-da253380-1da2-11ea-87e6-27e1c7d50114.png></denchmark-link>
I override the coco91class with [1,2,3,...,100], but the error not solve.

comments.comment: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/houzeyu2683>@houzeyu2683</denchmark-link> since your data is called 'coco.data' it thinks you are training on default COCO data, and it is trying to create a json for pycocotools mAP. If you rename your coco.data to something else, like custom.data it should work fine.

I've pushed a commit <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/commit/1bb738c83f363fdb654a2a5892b5675e35487a4a>1bb738c</denchmark-link> that should resolve this issue. Now we check to make sure the model has 80 classes in addition to having 'coco.data' in the data name before attempting to run pycocotools mAP on final epoch of training in L332:
yolov3/train.py
Lines 324 to 334 in 1bb738c
elif not opt.notest or final_epoch: # Calculate mAP
with torch.no_grad():
results, maps = test.test(cfg,
data,
batch_size=batch_size,
img_size=opt.img_size,
model=model,
conf_thres=0.001 if final_epoch else 0.1, # 0.1 for speed
save_json=final_epoch and 'coco.data' in data and model.nc == 80,
dataloader=testloader)
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/houzeyu2683>@houzeyu2683</denchmark-link> please and try again. I'll close this issue for now as original problem should be resolved.
